turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, can you recommend some good games? I'm really into RPGs right now.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Absolutely! RPGs are a fantastic genre. To start, are you looking for something more action-oriented, turn-based, or maybe story-driven?

turns.speaker: user

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Alright, story-driven action RPGs on PC. Popular and critically acclaimed options include The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt, Cyberpunk 2077, and Mass Effect Legendary Edition. Have you played any of those?

Ugh, it feels like I've played everything fitting that description.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Ah, I see. Diving into slightly less mainstream fantasy RPGs on PC with deep customization and meaningful choices... That narrows it down. Consider Pathfinder: Wrath of the Righteous or Baldur's Gate 3 (though that one's getting pretty popular now). turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: My apologies, I missed the preference against turn-based combat in that last response. Thank you for clarifying. Finding that exact combination with 'less mainstream' is challenging. It's a fantasy setting (unique colonial fantasy), PC, action combat, has story/choice elements, and some customization. It's not as massive as a AAA title, and often considered slightly less mainstream than The Witcher or Elden Ring.
